Exactly how the jgit DiffFormatter class does it...!

Various bits of tidying.

There is a nasty bug arising due to the re-use of views and the diffTexts map.

The map knows nothing about view re-use, so we end up believing that two children have difftexts which both actually reference the same editable text.
Disabling view re-use for Children - too unpredicateable, can not easily tell when my difftext should be invalidated!

Use only ToySshAgent for auth in integration tests

If you're running integration tests on your phone, and have another
ssh-agent installed (eg ConnectBot), then you don't want to have that
causing your tests to fail (if, for instance, you haven't got any
unlocked keys in ConnectBot)

Use Guava instead of the 'ancient and unmaintained' Google Collections

http://code.google.com/p/google-collections/ says:

What you see here is ancient and unmaintained. Do not use it.

Guava is a fully compatible superset of the old Google Collections Library. It also includes years worth of bug fixes, doc fixes, and performance fixes, so we strongly encourage you to use Guava instead of Google Collections.

Fix Sync so that it doesn't ask the user questions every time a sync occurs

Did this by defining an 'operation scope', where diferent kinds of
BlockingPromptService can be bound.

this, but it's basically a slightly souped-up version of a threadlocal,
which is what I'd have to use anyway.
